alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Montgomery; Northern Herkimer; Northern Warren; Northern Washington; Southern Fulton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 23 at 3:09AM EST until February 25 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and/or snowmelt and/or ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...The western and central Mohawk Valley, southern Adirondacks, Lake George area, and southern Vermont. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Storm total rainfall of 0.75 to 2.00 inches combined with snowmelt is leading to rises on area rivers and streams. Although additional rainfall is expected to be light through today, some localized flooding continues to be possible, especially in the vicinity of existing ice jams. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Hamilton; Montgomery; Northern Herkimer; Northern Warren; Northern Washington; Southern Fulton
